intro: Trigonella komarovii, commonly known as Komarov's fenugreek, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with trifoliate leaves and small yellow flowers. Its seeds are enclosed in a hairy, triangular pod, which is a distinctive feature of the genus Trigonella. This species is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought-resistant traits.
